Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: RKM Teradata
AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION This module reverse the metadata from Teradata database using the DBC system views. Reverse engineers tables and columns from a Teradata Database using the DBC system views. It includes Keys (primary indexes and secondary indexes) and Foreign Keys
The unique primary index is reverse as a primary key. The primary index is reverse as a non unique index. The Secondary unique primary index is reverse as an alternate key. The Secondary non unique primary index is reverse as a non unique index.
REQUIREMENTS - for unicode support, JDBC connect string needs to be modified to support unicode eg. jdbc:teradata://DemoTDAT/CHARSET=UTF8
OPTIONS (Refer to Option description for more information on each option) - REVERSE_FKS: Reverse FKs from Teradata. FKs are rarely used in Teradata - REVERSE_TABLE_CONSTRAINTS: Reverse table constraints from Teradata.
LIMITATIONS - The connected user must have read access on the DBC system views. - Reverses Tables and Views as defined by: DBC.Tables.TableKind in ('T' or 'V') - Reversing of view columns can take significant amount of time - No explicit CHARACTERSET clause will be created. This means that for databases in single-byte character mode ODI will not automatically create CHARACTER SET UNICODE clause for multi-byte character columns.
Foreign Keys are seldom used in Teradata, but they are supported. This option allows the user to to choose whether or not to reverse engineer existing FK constraints in the database.
This option allows the user to to choose whether or not to reverse engineer existing table constraints in the database.

This option currently only works to obtain UNICODE column character set specification for both VARCHAR and CHAR datatypes.
If set to TRUE, VARCHAR and CHAR for a Unicode database will be reversed as CHAR()CHARACTER SET UNICODE or VARCHAR()CHARACTER SET UNICODE respectively regardless of the use of CHARACTER SET UNICODE clause at table creation.

columnPatterns = JHashMap()
# Iterate over all tables for tableName in columnLists.keySet(): # For every table compile the appropriate column matcher colList = columnLists.get( tableName ) patternStr = JStringBuffer( r"\b(" ) for col in colList: patternStr.append( JString( col ) ) patternStr.append( "|" ) patternStr.setLength( patternStr.length()-1 ) patternStr.append( r")\b" ) pattern = JPattern.compile( patternStr.toString() ) columnPatterns.put( tableName, pattern )

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang import java.io.File as File
iMod = '<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>' dbName = "#SCHEMA_NAME" revObjPat = "<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>" if (revObjPat==""): revObjPat = "%"
# Source (Teradata) connection srcCon = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("SRC")
# Target (Repository) connection trgCon = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST")
# Method to put quotes around strings and to change None to NULL for use in a SQL statement def fixString(s): if s == None: fixed = "NULL" else: fixed = "'" + s.replace( "'", "''" ) + "'" return fixed
# Method to put quotes around strings and to change None to NULL for use in a SQL statement; use '?' in place of NULL string def fixStringNotNull(s): if s == None: return "'?'" else: return fixString(s)
# Complete all column references with their respective table alias def processCondition( sCond, sTableName ): sAlias = aliasList.get( sTableName ) out = JStringBuffer() matcher = columnPatterns.get( sTableName ).matcher( sCond ) found = matcher.find() while found: # Get the match result replaceStr = matcher.group() # Append text before match matcher.appendReplacement( out, "" ) # Insert replacement out.append( sAlias ) out.append( "." ) out.append( replaceStr ) found = matcher.find() matcher.appendTail( out ) return out.toString()
try: srcStmt1 = srcCon.createStatement() trgStmt1 = trgCon.createStatement()
# Define the query to get the column details (for views) sqlGetConstraints = """select trim(TableName) (named CK_TABLE_NAME), trim(ConstraintName) (named CK_NAME), trim(ConstraintText) (named CK_COND) from DBC.Table_LevelConstraints where DatabaseName = '%s' and trim (TableName) like '%s' """ % (dbName, revObjPat)
# Get the columns for the views rsConstraints = srcStmt1.executeQuery(sqlGetConstraints)
# Loop over the Result Set containing the View Columns and execute the 'help column' command to get the secret datatype info for each column while rsConstraints.next(): sTableName = rsConstraints.getString("CK_TABLE_NAME") sCondName = rsConstraints.getString("CK_NAME") #if (sCondName==null): sCondName = '' sCondition = JString( rsConstraints.getString("CK_COND") )
# Sample condition: "CONSTRAINT TRG_CKM_TEST_TABLE_CHK CHECK ( DB_CONDITION_COL < 900001 )" # So we need to cut out the condition string: sCondition = JString( sCondition.substring( sCondition.indexOf("(")+1, sCondition.lastIndexOf(")") ).strip() )
# Insert row into SNP_REV_COND sqlInsertCond = """ insert into SNP_REV_COND (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,COND_NAME,COND_TYPE,COND_SQL,COND_MESS,IND_ACTIVE,CHECK_STAT,CHECK_FLOW) values ('<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>', %s, %s, 'D', %s, null,'1','1','1') """ % (fixString(sTableName), fixStringNotNull(sCondName), fixString( processCondition( sCondition, sTableName) ) )
trgStmt1.executeUpdate(sqlInsertCond)
finally: srcCon.close() trgCon.close()

import java.lang.StringBuffer as JStringBuffer import java.lang.String as JString import java.util.HashMap as JHashMap import java.util.ArrayList as JArrayList import java.util.regex.Pattern as JPattern columnLists = JHashMap() aliasList = JHashMap()

# Is this table already in HashMap? if not(columnLists.containsKey( r"""#TABLE_NAME""" ) ): # No, then lets add it colList = JArrayList() colList.add( r"""#COL_NAME""" ) columnLists.put( r"""#TABLE_NAME""", colList ) aliasList.put( r"""#TABLE_NAME""", r"""#TABLE_ALIAS""" ) else: # Append this column colList = columnLists.get( r"""#TABLE_NAME""" ) colList .add( r"""#COL_NAME""" ) columnLists.put( r"""#TABLE_NAME""", colList )

select trim(c.TableName) TABLE_NAME, trim(c.ColumnName) COL_NAME, upper(substr(T.TableName, 1, 3)) TABLE_ALIAS from DBC.Columns c, DBC.Tables t where c.DatabaseName = '<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>' and c.DatabaseName = t.DatabaseName and c.TableName like '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>%' and c.TableName = t.TableName and t.TableKind = 'T' and position(';T;' in ';'||'<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_TYPE")%>'||';') > 0

insert into SNP_REV_TABLE (MOD_GUID, TABLE_NAME, RES_NAME, TABLE_ALIAS, TABLE_TYPE, TABLE_DESC_C, IND_SHOW) values ('<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>', :TABLE_NAME, :RES_NAME, :TABLE_ALIAS, :TABLE_TYPE, :TABLE_DESC, '1')

select trim(T.TableName) TABLE_NAME, trim(T.TableName) RES_NAME, upper(substr(T.TableName, 1, 3)) TABLE_ALIAS, T.TableKind TABLE_TYPE, T.CommentString TABLE_DESC from DBC.Tables T where T.DatabaseName = '<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>' and T.TableName like '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>%' and ( (T.TableKind = 'T' and position(';T;' in ';'||'<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_TYPE")%>'||';') > 0) or (T.TableKind = 'V' and position(';V;' in ';'||'<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_TYPE")%>'||';') > 0) )

insert into SNP_REV_COL ( MOD_GUID, TABLE_NAME, COL_NAME, COL_HEADING, DT_DRIVER, COL_DESC_C, POS, LONGC, SCALEC, COL_MANDATORY, COL_FORMAT, DEF_VALUE, CHECK_STAT, CHECK_FLOW) values ( '<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>', :TABLE_NAME, :COL_NAME, :COL_HEADING, :DT_DRIVER, :COL_DESC, :POS, :LONGC, :SCALEC, :COL_MANDATORY, :COL_FORMAT, :DEF_VALUE, '1', '1')

select trim(c.TableName) TABLE_NAME, trim(c.ColumnName) COL_NAME, substr(coalesce(c.ColumnTitle,c.ColumnName),1,35) COL_HEADING, c.CommentString COL_DESC, CASE c.ColumnType WHEN 'AT' THEN 'TIME' WHEN 'TZ' THEN 'TIME() WITH TIME ZONE' WHEN 'BF' THEN 'BYTE' WHEN 'BO' THEN 'BLOB' WHEN 'BV' THEN 'BYTE' WHEN 'CF' THEN (case when c.CHARTYPE = 2 AND <%=odiRef.getOption("REVERSE_COLUMN_CHARACTER_SET")%> = 1 then 'CHAR() CHARACTER SET UNICODE' else 'CHAR' end) WHEN 'CO' THEN 'CLOB' WHEN 'CV' THEN (case when c.CHARTYPE = 2 AND <%=odiRef.getOption("REVERSE_COLUMN_CHARACTER_SET")%> = 1 then 'VARCHAR() CHARACTER SET UNICODE' else 'VARCHAR' end) WHEN 'D' THEN 'DECIMAL' WHEN 'DH' THEN 'INTERVAL DAY() TO HOUR' WHEN 'DM' THEN 'INTERVAL DAY() TO MINUTE' WHEN 'DS' THEN 'INTERVAL DAY() TO SECOND' WHEN 'DY' THEN 'INTERVAL DAY()' WHEN 'DA' THEN 'DATE' WHEN 'F' THEN 'FLOAT' WHEN 'HR' THEN 'INTERVAL HOUR()' WHEN 'HM' THEN 'INTERVAL HOUR() TO MINUTE' WHEN 'HS' THEN 'INTERVAL HOUR() TO SECOND' WHEN 'I' THEN 'INTEGER' WHEN 'I1' THEN 'BYTEINT' WHEN 'I2' THEN 'SMALLINT' WHEN 'I8' THEN 'BIGINT' WHEN 'MI' THEN 'INTERVAL MINUTE()' WHEN 'MS' THEN 'INTERVAL MINUTE() TO SECOND' WHEN 'MO' THEN 'INTERVAL MONTH' WHEN 'SC' THEN 'INTERVAL SECOND' WHEN 'SZ' THEN CASE c.DecimalFractionalDigits WHEN 0 THEN 'TIMESTAMP(0) WITH TIME ZONE' ELSE 'TIMESTAMP() WITH TIME ZONE' END WHEN 'TS' THEN CASE c.DecimalFractionalDigits WHEN 0 THEN 'TIMESTAMP(0)' ELSE 'TIMESTAMP' END WHEN 'YR' THEN 'INTERVAL YEAR' WHEN 'YM' THEN 'INTERVAL YEAR() TO MONTH' ELSE c.ColumnType END DT_DRIVER, CASE WHEN c.ColumnId > 1024 THEN c.ColumnId - 1024 ELSE c.ColumnId END POS, CASE -- Decimal WHEN c.ColumnType = 'D' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits
-- TIMESTAMP and TIMESTAMP with TIME ZONE WHEN c.ColumnType = 'TS' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'SZ' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits
-- Interval data types WHEN c.ColumnType = 'DH' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'DM' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'DS' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'DY' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'HR' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'HM' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'HS' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'MI' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'MS' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'MO' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'SC' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'YR' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'YM' THEN c.DecimalTotalDigits
-- TIME and TIME WITH TIME ZONE WHEN c.ColumnType = 'AT' OR c.ColumnType = 'TZ' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'CF' OR c.ColumnType = 'CO' OR c.ColumnType = 'CV' THEN CASE c.CharType WHEN 1 THEN c.ColumnLength ELSE c.ColumnLength / 2 -- two bytes characters END ELSE c.ColumnLength END LONGC, CASE -- Decimal WHEN c.ColumnType = 'D' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits
-- Interval data types with second precision WHEN c.ColumnType = 'DS' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'HS' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'MS' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits WHEN c.ColumnType = 'SC' THEN c.DecimalFractionalDigits
ELSE 0 END SCALEC, CASE WHEN c.Nullable = 'Y' THEN '0' ELSE '1' END COL_MANDATORY, substr(c.ColumnFormat, 1, 35) COL_FORMAT, substr(c.DefaultValue, 1, 100) DEF_VALUE from DBC.Columns c, DBC.Tables t Where c.DatabaseName = '<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>' and c.DatabaseName = t.DatabaseName and c.TableName like '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>%' and c.TableName = t.TableName and t.TableKind = 'T' and position(';T;' in ';'||'<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_TYPE")%>'||';') > 0

insert into SNP_REV_KEY (MOD_GUID, TABLE_NAME, KEY_NAME, CONS_TYPE, IND_ACTIVE, CHECK_FLOW, CHECK_STAT) Values ('<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>', :TABLE_NAME, :KEY_NAME, :CONS_TYPE, '1', '1', '1' )

-- Warning: Do not remove paranthesis around coalesce function!!! at least in V2R6 due to a bug in TD's SQL parser; Fixed in TD V12
select distinct trim(i.TableName) TABLE_NAME, case when i.IndexType in ('P','K') then case when i.UniqueFlag = 'Y' then 'PK' else 'I' end when i.IndexType in ('U', 'S') and i.UniqueFlag = 'Y' then 'AK' else 'I' end CONS_TYPE, -- Has the index no explicit name? CASE WHEN trim(i.IndexName) IS NULL THEN -- There is no explicit name, so let's find one... CASE -- Is it a [nonpartitioned] primary index? WHEN i.IndexType in ('P','K') THEN -- Is it unique? case when i.UniqueFlag = 'Y' then 'UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX' else 'PRIMARY INDEX' end -- Is it a secondary index? WHEN i.IndexType = 'S' THEN 'SECONDARY INDEX' -- okay, no smart name, so let's build a generic one... ELSE trim(i.IndexType)||'_'||trim(i.TableName)||'_'||trim(i.IndexNumber) END ELSE -- okay, let's use the declared index name... trim(i.IndexName) END KEY_NAME
from DBC.Indices i where i.DatabaseName = '<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>' and i.TableName like '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>'
insert into SNP_REV_KEY_COL ( MOD_GUID, TABLE_NAME, KEY_NAME, COL_NAME, POS) Values ('<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>', :TABLE_NAME, :KEY_NAME, :COL_NAME, :POS)

select trim(i.TableName) TABLE_NAME, -- Has the index no explicit name? CASE WHEN trim(i.IndexName) IS NULL THEN -- There is no explicit name, so let's find one... CASE -- Is it a [nonpartitioned] primary index? WHEN i.IndexType in ('P','K') THEN -- Is it unique? case when i.UniqueFlag = 'Y' then 'UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX' else 'PRIMARY INDEX' end -- Is it a secondary index? WHEN i.IndexType = 'S' THEN 'SECONDARY INDEX' -- okay, no smart name, so let's build a generic one... ELSE trim(i.IndexType)||'_'||trim(i.TableName)||'_'||trim(i.IndexNumber) END ELSE -- okay, let's use the declared index name... trim(i.IndexName) END KEY_NAME, trim(i.ColumnName) COL_NAME, i.ColumnPosition POS from DBC.Indices i where i.DatabaseName = '<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>' and i.TableName like '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>'

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang import java.io.File as File
iMod = '<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>' dbName = "#SCHEMA_NAME" revObjPat = "<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>" if (revObjPat==""): revObjPat = "%"
# Source (Teradata) connection srcCon = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("SRC")
# Target (Repository) connection trgCon = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST")
# Method to put quotes around strings and to change None to NULL for use in a SQL statement def fixString(s): if s == None: fixed = "NULL" else: fixed = "'" + s + "'" return fixed
try: srcStmt1 = srcCon.createStatement() srcStmt2 = srcCon.createStatement() trgStmt1 = trgCon.createStatement()
# Define the query to get the column details (for views) sqlGetViewCols = """SELECT trim(c.TableName) VIEW_NAME ,trim(c.ColumnName) COL_NAME ,trim(c.CharType) COL_CHARTYPE ,c.ColumnId COL_ID FROM DBC.Columns c, DBC.Tables t WHERE c.DatabaseName = '%s' AND c.DatabaseName = t.DatabaseName AND c.TableName like '%s' AND c.TableName = t.TableName AND t.TableKind = 'V' AND position(';V;' in ';'||'<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_TYPE")%>'||';') > 0 """ % (dbName, revObjPat)
# Get the columns for the views rsViewCols = srcStmt1.executeQuery(sqlGetViewCols)
# Loop over the Result Set containing the View Columns and execute the 'help column' command to get the secret datatype info for each column while (rsViewCols.next()): tabName = rsViewCols.getString("VIEW_NAME") colName = rsViewCols.getString("COL_NAME") colCharType = rsViewCols.getString("COL_CHARTYPE") qColDetails = "help column %s.%s.%s" % ( dbName, tabName, colName )
try: rsColDetails = srcStmt2.executeQuery(qColDetails) except: continue
# Insert the data into the Sunopsis Reverse Engineering table while (rsColDetails.next()): colHeading = rsColDetails.getString("Title") if colHeading == None: colHeading = colName colDesc = rsColDetails.getString("Title")
# Translate date types colDt = rsColDetails.getString("Type") if colDt.strip() == 'AT': colDt = 'TIME' elif colDt.strip() == 'BF': colDt = 'BYTE' elif colDt.strip() == 'BO': colDt = 'BLOB' elif colDt.strip() == 'BV': colDt = 'BYTE' elif colDt.strip() == 'CF': colDt = 'CHAR' elif colDt.strip() == 'CF': if <%=odiRef.getOption("REVERSE_COLUMN_CHARACTER_SET")%> == 0: colDt = 'CHAR' elif colCharType == '2': colDt = 'CHAR() CHARACTER SET UNICODE' else: colDt = 'CHAR' elif colDt.strip() == 'CO': colDt = 'CLOB' elif colDt.strip() == 'CV': if <%=odiRef.getOption("REVERSE_COLUMN_CHARACTER_SET")%> == 0: colDt = 'VARCHAR' elif colCharType == '2': colDt = 'VARCHAR() CHARACTER SET UNICODE' else: colDt = 'VARCHAR' elif colDt.strip() == 'D' : colDt = 'DECIMAL' elif colDt.strip() == 'DA': colDt = 'DATE' elif colDt.strip() == 'DH': colDt = 'INTERVAL DAY() TO HOUR' elif colDt.strip() == 'DM': colDt = 'INTERVAL DAY() TO MINUTE' elif colDt.strip() == 'DS': colDt = 'INTERVAL DAY() TO SECOND' elif colDt.strip() == 'DY': colDt = 'INTERVAL DAY()' elif colDt.strip() == 'F' : colDt = 'FLOAT' elif colDt.strip() == 'HR' : colDt = 'INTERVAL HOUR()' elif colDt.strip() == 'HM': colDt = 'INTERVAL HOUR() TO MINUTE' elif colDt.strip() == 'HS' : colDt = 'INTERVAL HOUR() TO SECOND' elif colDt.strip() == 'I' : colDt = 'INTEGER' elif colDt.strip() == 'I1' : colDt = 'INTEGER' elif colDt.strip() == 'I2' : colDt = 'SMALLINT' elif colDt.strip() == 'I8' : colDt = 'BIGINT' elif colDt.strip() == 'MI' : colDt = 'INTERVAL MINUTE()' elif colDt.strip() == 'MS': colDt = 'INTERVAL MINUTE() TO SECOND' elif colDt.strip() == 'MO': colDt = 'INTERVAL MONTH' elif colDt.strip() == 'SC': colDt = 'INTERVAL SECOND' elif colDt.strip() == 'TS': if rsColDetails.getInt("Decimal Fractional Digits") == 0: colDt = 'TIMESTAMP(0)' else : colDt = 'TIMESTAMP' elif colDt.strip() == 'SZ': if rsColDetails.getInt("Decimal Fractional Digits") == 0: colDt = 'TIMESTAMP(0) WITH TIME ZONE' else : colDt = 'TIMESTAMP() WITH TIME ZONE' elif colDt.strip() == 'TZ': colDt = 'TIME() WITH TIME ZONE' elif colDt.strip() == 'YR': colDt = 'INTERVAL YEAR' elif colDt.strip() == 'YM': colDt = 'INTERVAL YEAR() TO MONTH'
# Set column position colPos = rsViewCols.getInt("COL_ID") % 1024 # Teradata returns 1025 for column 1, so we take COL_ID modulo 1024. Note that we get the column ordering from the first query, since 'help column' doesn't return this value
# Set Length, Scale and Bytes colBytes = rsColDetails.getInt("Max Length") colLen = rsColDetails.getInt("Max Length") colScale = 0 if colDt == 'DECIMAL' or colDt == 'NUMERIC' or colDt == 'FLOAT': colLen = rsColDetails.getInt("Decimal Total Digits") # For Decimal datatypes we use Digits rather than Length (bytes) colScale = rsColDetails.getInt("Decimal Fractional Digits") # Scale is set only for Decimal (0 for all other datatypes) if colDt == 'TIME' or colDt == 'TIME() WITH TIME ZONE' or colDt == 'TIMESTAMP' or colDt == 'TIMESTAMP() WITH TIME ZONE' or colDt == 'TIMESTAMP(0)' or colDt == 'TIMESTAMP(0) WITH TIME ZONE': colLen = rsColDetails.getInt("Decimal Fractional Digits") colScale = 0 if colDt == 'CHAR' or colDt == 'VARCHAR' or colDt == 'CLOB': if rsColDetails.getInt("Char Type") == 1: # Is this a single-byte character field? colLen = rsColDetails.getInt("Max Length") colScale = 0 else: colLen = rsColDetails.getInt("Max Length") / 2 colScale = 0 if colDt.startswith( 'INTERVAL' ): colLen = rsColDetails.getInt("Decimal Total Digits") if colDt.endswith( 'SECOND' ): colScale = rsColDetails.getInt("Decimal Fractional Digits") else: colScale = 0
# Set Nullable flag if rsColDetails.getString("Nullable") == 'N': colMand = 1 else: colMand = 0 colFlow = 1 colStat = 1
# Insert row into SNP_REV_COL sqlInsertViewCols = "insert into SNP_REV_COL (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,COL_NAME,COL_HEADING,COL_DESC_C,DT_DRIVER,POS,LONGC,SCALEC,BYTES,COL_MANDATORY,CHECK_FLOW,CHECK_STAT) values (%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s)" % ( fixString(iMod), fixString(tabName), fixString(colName), fixString(colHeading), fixString(colDesc), fixString(colDt), colPos, colLen, colScale, colBytes, colMand, colFlow, colStat )
trgStmt1.executeUpdate(sqlInsertViewCols)
finally: srcCon.close() trgCon.close()

insert into SNP_REV_JOIN (MOD_GUID, TABLE_NAME, FK_NAME, FK_TYPE, PK_SCHEMA, PK_TABLE_NAME, CHECK_FLOW, CHECK_STAT, IND_ACTIVE) Values ('<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>', :FK_TABLE_NAME, :FK_NAME, 'D', :PK_SCHEMA, :PK_TABLE_NAME, '1', '1', '1' )

select distinct trim(pt.TableName) PK_TABLE_NAME, trim(ctab.TableName) FK_TABLE_NAME, CASE WHEN trim(ri.IndexName) IS NULL THEN 'FK_'||trim(pt.TableName)||'_'||trim(ctab.TableName)||'_'||trim(ri.IndexId) ELSE trim(ri.IndexName) END FK_NAME, trim(pt.DatabaseName) PK_SCHEMA from DBC.RI_Distinct_Children ri, DBC.Tables pt, DBC.Tables ctab where ri.ParentDb = pt.DatabaseName and ri.ParentTable = pt.TableName and ri.ChildDb = ctab.DatabaseName and ri.ChildTable = ctab.TableName and pt.DatabaseName = '<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>' and pt.TableName like '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>'

insert into SNP_REV_JOIN_COL ( MOD_GUID, FK_NAME, FK_TABLE_NAME, FK_COL_NAME, PK_TABLE_NAME, PK_COL_NAME, POS) Values ('<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>', :FK_NAME, :FK_TABLE_NAME, :FK_COL_NAME, :PK_TABLE_NAME, :PK_COL_NAME, :POS)

select CASE WHEN trim(rt.IndexName) IS NULL THEN 'FK_'||trim(rt.ParentTable)||'_'||trim(rt.ChildTable) ELSE trim(rt.IndexName) END FK_NAME , trim(rt.ParentTable) PK_TABLE_NAME, trim(rt.ParentKeyColumn) PK_COL_NAME, trim(rt.ChildTable) FK_TABLE_NAME, trim(rt.ChildKeyColumn) FK_COL_NAME, 1 POS from dbc.All_RI_Children rt where trim(rt.ParentDB) like trim('<%=odiRef.getModel("SCHEMA_NAME")%>') and trim(rt.ParentTable) like '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>'
DEMO.RKM Teradata.Get Check constraints: Compile patterns
DEMO.RKM Teradata.Get Check constraint: Import Constraints
DEMO.RKM Teradata.Get Check constraints: Init HashMaps
DEMO.RKM Teradata.Get Check constraints: Fill HashMaps
